message_1:
Consider an auction where there are five bidders and one item for sale. The true values of the item to each bidder are as follows:

Bidder 1: $100 
Bidder 2: $80 
Bidder 3: $60 
Bidder 4: $40 
Bidder 5: $20

Suppose this is a sealed-bid second-price auction (also known as a Vickrey auction), where the highest bidder wins the item and pays the second-highest bid. If each bidder makes their bid, what will the final sale price of the item be and which bidder will win the auction?
message_2:
In a sealed-bid second-price auction, each bidder submits their bid without knowing the bids of the other bidders. The highest bidder wins the item and pays the second-highest bid.

In this case, the bids are as follows:

Bidder 1: $100
Bidder 2: $80
Bidder 3: $60
Bidder 4: $40
Bidder 5: $20

Bidder 1 has the highest bid at $100, so they will win the auction. The second-highest bid is $80 from Bidder 2. Therefore, the final sale price of the item will be $80.
